result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Deragon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas A. Deragon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas A. Deragon was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Nicholas A. Deragon was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: JOC amended 05-06-2019: It is Ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office Staff and will be based upon actual release date. It Is furthered Order that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs totaling $518.00.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.
Undergo and successfully complete Cognitive Behavior Class.  Mental health assessment and follow through with all recommendations of counselor.

Not to possess alcohol or illegal drugs.  Not to allow anyone to have access to medications.  No contact with family of victim unless they consent in writing with agent.   As a convicted felon, prohibited from voting until civil rights restored.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Voluntarily consult with physician re: benefits of medical treatment including pharmaceutical options to help with alcoholism.  Take all medications as prescribed by a physician and take them only as prescribed.  Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
